SourcedStatement: At one point, Mr. Altman, the chief executive, made a move to push out one of the board's members because he thought a research paper she had co-written was critical of the company.
Name: Sam Altman
Title: chief executive, OpenAI

SourcedStatement: Another member, Ilya Sutskever, thought Mr. Altman was not always being honest when talking with the board. And some board members worried that Mr. Altman was too focused on expansion while they wanted to balance that growth with A.I. safety.
Name: Ilya Sutskever
Title: OpenAI board member
Justification: had worked closely with Mr. Altman at OpenAI for eight years

SourcedStatement: Mr. Altman complained that the research paper seemed to criticize OpenAI's efforts to keep its A.I. technologies safe while praising the approach taken by Anthropic, a company that has become OpenAI's biggest rival, according to an email that Mr. Altman wrote to colleagues and that was viewed by The New York Times. In the email, Mr. Altman said that he had reprimanded Ms. Toner for the paper and that it was dangerous to the company, particularly at a time, he added, when the Federal Trade Commission was investigating OpenAI over the data used to build its technology.
Name: email from Sam Altman
Justification: email that Mr. Altman wrote to colleagues and that was viewed by The New York Times

SourcedStatement: Ms. Toner defended it as an academic paper that analyzed the challenges that the public faces when trying to understand the intentions of the countries and companies developing A.I.
Name: Helen Toner
Title: director of strategy at Georgetown University's Center for Security and Emerging Technology

SourcedStatement: 'I did not feel we're on the same page on the damage of all this,' he wrote in the email. 'Any amount of criticism from a board member carries a lot of weight.'
Name: email from Sam Altman
Justification: email that Mr. Altman wrote to colleagues and that was viewed by The New York Times

SourcedStatement: Senior OpenAI leaders, including Mr. Sutskever, who is deeply concerned that A.I. could one day destroy humanity, later discussed whether Ms. Toner should be removed, a person involved in the conversations said.

But shortly after those discussions, Mr. Sutskever did the unexpected: He sided with board members to oust Mr. Altman, according to two people familiar with the board's deliberations. The statement he read to Mr. Altman said that Mr. Altman was being fired because he wasn't 'consistently candid in his communications with the board.'
Justification: people familiar with the board's deliberations

SourcedStatement: Mr. Sutskever's frustration with Mr. Altman echoed what had happened in 2021 when another senior A.I. scientist left OpenAI to form Anthropic. That scientist and other researchers went to the board to try to push Mr. Altman out. After they failed, they gave up and departed, according to three people familiar with the attempt to push Mr. Altman out.
Justification: people familiar with the attempt to push Mr. Altman out

SourcedStatement: 'After a series of reasonably amicable negotiations, the co-founders of Anthropic were able to negotiate their exit on mutually agreeable terms,' an Anthropic spokeswoman, Sally Aldous, said. In a second statement, Anthropic added that there was 'no attempt to 'oust' Sam Altman at the time the founders of Anthropic left OpenAI.'
Name: Sally Aldous
Title: Anthropic spokeswoman

SourcedStatement: After vetting four candidates for one position, the remaining directors couldn't agree on who should fill it, said the two people familiar with the board's deliberations. The stalemate hardened the divide between Mr. Altman and Mr. Brockman and other board members.
Justification: people familiar with the board's deliberations

SourcedStatement: During the call, Jason Kwon, OpenAI's chief strategy officer, said the board was endangering the future of the company by pushing out Mr. Altman. This, he said, violated the members' responsibilities.
Name: Jason Kwon
Title: OpenAI's chief strategy officer

SourcedStatement: Ms. Toner disagreed. The board's mission was to ensure that the company creates artificial intelligence that 'benefits all of humanity,' and if the company was destroyed, she said, that could be consistent with its mission. In the board's view, OpenAI would be stronger without Mr. Altman.
Name: Helen Toner
Title: director of strategy at Georgetown University's Center for Security and Emerging Technology
